BearerAuth.description: The bearer token will be provided upon request and it is up to the client to keep it secret. Every api call needs to contain this token in order to authenticate and authorize the client.

UnauthorizedError.description: Access token is missing or invalid

Fields.description:
Additional fields that should be populated.
- `hostRoomUrl` - Include hostRoomUrl field in the meeting response.

roomUrl.description: The URL to room where the meeting will be hosted.

startDate.description: When the meeting starts in UTC.

endDate.description: When the meeting ends in UTC.

hostRoomUrl.description:
The URL to room where the meeting will be hosted which will also make the user the host of the
meeting. A host will get additional privileges like locking and recording, and you should therefore
be careful with whom you share this URL. The user will only become a host if the meeting is on-going (some additional
slack is added to allow a host joining the meeting ahead of time or if the meeting goes over time).
This field is optional and will only provided if requested through fields parameter.

post.description:
Creates a meeting as specified.
It will also create a transient room that is guaranteed to be available for specified start and end time. Some time after the meeting has ended, the transient room will be automatically deleted.
The URL to this room is present in the response.

isLocked.description:
The initial lock state of the room. If true, only hosts will be able to let in other participants
and change lock state.

roomNamePrefix.description:
This will be used as the prefix for the room name. Note that the room name needs to start with /
if it is provided and should be lower-case.

roomNamePattern.description:
The format of the randomly generated room name.
`uuid` is the default room name pattern and follows the usual 8-4-4-4-12 pattern.
`human-short` generates a shorter string made up of six distinguishable characters.

roomMode.description:
The mode of the created transient room.
`normal` is the default room mode and should be used for meetings up to 4 participants.
`group` should be used for meetings that require more than 4 participants.

startDate.description: When the meeting starts in UTC. This has to be newer than the current date.

endDate.description: When the meeting ends in UTC. This has to be the same or after the startDate.

delete.description: Deletes the specified meeting. The endpoint is idempotent, meaning it will return the same response even if the meeting has already been deleted.

200.description: A JSON object representing the meeting.
